response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (20 years old)", "medium", "Being young is associated with higher risk-taking behavior and potential instability, but the age factor is not definitive on its own."],
    ["Gender (Male)", "high", "Statistically, males have a higher likelihood of recidivism, contributing significantly to the risk profile."],
    ["Race (White)", "low", "Race in this context does not present as a significant risk factor for recidivism."],
    ["Arrest Record (1 arrest, no conviction)", "medium", "A prior arrest suggests some engagement with the criminal justice system, though the lack of conviction moderates the risk somewhat."],
    ["Living Situation (Living alone)", "medium", "Living alone can indicate less social support, which may increase the likelihood of reoffending."],
    ["Education (High school diploma with college enrollment)", "low", "Ongoing higher education is a protective factor that typically correlates with reduced recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment History (2 jobs during the year)", "medium", "Some employment stability exists; however, multiple jobs may signal transitional instability affecting risk."],
    ["Substance Use (Cocaine use in the past four years)", "high", "Recent cocaine use is a strong risk factor for recidivism due to its association with impulsivity and potential involvement in criminal networks."],
    ["Mental Health (No recent depression)", "low", "Absence of depressive symptoms suggests lower immediate risk related to mental health issues."],
    ["Early Life/Household (Lived with biological mother in an urban setting, household size 3)", "medium", "An urban upbringing can expose individuals to environments with higher crime rates, though family presence and small household size may be protective."],
    ["Religiosity (Believes God has a role in his life)", "low", "Acknowledgment of a higher power can be associated with positive coping strategies and lower recidivism risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Being young is associated with higher risk-taking behavior and potential instability, but the age factor is not definitive on its own.
Statistically, males have a higher likelihood of recidivism, contributing significantly to the risk profile.
Race in this context does not present as a significant risk factor for recidivism.
A prior arrest suggests some engagement with the criminal justice system, though the lack of conviction moderates the risk somewhat.
Living alone can indicate less social support, which may increase the likelihood of reoffending.
Education (High school diploma with college enrollment)
Ongoing higher education is a protective factor that typically correlates with reduced recidivism risk.
Employment History (2 jobs during the year)
Some employment stability exists; however, multiple jobs may signal transitional instability affecting risk.
Substance Use (Cocaine use in the past four years)
Recent cocaine use is a strong risk factor for recidivism due to its association with impulsivity and potential involvement in criminal networks.
Absence of depressive symptoms suggests lower immediate risk related to mental health issues.
Early Life/Household (Lived with biological mother in an urban setting, household size 3)
An urban upbringing can expose individuals to environments with higher crime rates, though family presence and small household size may be protective.
Religiosity (Believes God has a role in his life)
Acknowledgment of a higher power can be associated with positive coping strategies and lower recidivism risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 9 inches and weighs 160 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 4-year college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (cocaine) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 3, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
